data.scheme_name: Credit Guarantee Scheme for Farmers Producer Organizations (FPOs) Financing  - Existing
data.benefits: Scheme provides Credit guarantee cover for loan maximum up to 150 lakhs.
data.eligibility: Farmer Producer Organization incorporated/registered either under part IXA of Companies Act or under Co-operative societies.
data.conditions:
FPO should have minimum farmers size of 300. 

Non-Eligibility of credit facilities under the scheme : 

  • Credit facilities sanctioned against collateral security or a third-party guarantee. 
  • Credit facilities covered by additional risk schemes operated by RBI, the Government, an insurer, or similar entities. 
  • Credit facilities that do not comply with applicable laws or directives from the Central Government or RBI. 
  • Credit facilities for which any lending institution has previously invoked a credit guarantee. 
  • Credit facilities granted to a borrower who has previously availed a credit facility under another scheme with a credit guarantee. 
  • Credit facilities that are overdue for repayment or classified as Non-Performing Assets (NPA). 
  • Credit facilities that have been rescheduled or restructured due to repayment issues.
data.beneficiaries: Farmer Producer Organization incorporated/registered either under part IXA of Companies Act or under Co-operative societies.
data.prerequisites:
FPO should have minimum farmers size of 300. 

Non-Eligibility of credit facilities under the scheme : 

  • Credit facilities sanctioned against collateral security or a third-party guarantee. 
  • Credit facilities covered by additional risk schemes operated by RBI, the Government, an insurer, or similar entities. 
  • Credit facilities that do not comply with applicable laws or directives from the Central Government or RBI. 
  • Credit facilities for which any lending institution has previously invoked a credit guarantee. 
  • Credit facilities granted to a borrower who has previously availed a credit facility under another scheme with a credit guarantee. 
  • Credit facilities that are overdue for repayment or classified as Non-Performing Assets (NPA). 
  • Credit facilities that have been rescheduled or restructured due to repayment issues.
data.context: In order to ensure access of FPOs to credit from mainstream Banks and Financial Institutions, there is a need to create a dedicated Credit Guarantee Fund. This CGF will provide adequate credit guarantee cover to accelerate flow of institutional credit to FPOs by minimizing the risk of financial institutions for granting loans to their increased viability.
data.objective: Objective of credit guarantee fund is to provide a credit guarantee cover for loan to FPOs by Eligible Lending Institutions thereby minimizing their lending risk in respect of Credit Facilities so as to encourage them to provide collateral free credit to FPOs.
data.description:
1. The maximum credit guarantee cover per FPO at any point of time under the scheme will be limited to RS.150 lakhs. 
  2. In case of credit facility up to Rs.100 lakhs guarantee cover will be 85% of sanctioned credit with ceiling of Rs.85 lakhs. 
  3. In case of credit facility above Rs100crore credit guarantee cover will be 75% of the sanctioned credit with a maximum ceiling of Rs. 150 crore.
data.how_to_apply:
Applicant has to apply on the below mentioned link
http://sfacindia.com/CGFApplicationForm.aspx
data.funding_mechanism: Guarantee Coverage will be provided after approval of application by NABSanrakshan
data.checklist_info_a:
Application is as per the prescribed format and bear signature with seal of bank.
Recommendations with amount of CGC sought on Bank’s letter head with date and dispatch number duly signed by the Branch Manager on each page
Sanction letter of Sanctioning authority addressed to the recommending branch.
Bank’s approved appraisal/process note bearing signature of sanctioning authority.
Potential impact –Social, Environmental, risk analysis report.
Promoter’s request letter addressed to the Bank Manager on original letter head of FPC.
Implementation schedule confirmed by the Bank.
Up to date statement of a/c of TL/CC if already sanctioned.
Equity/CA Certificate./ RCS Certificate
Form-2, Form-5 and Form-23 filed with RoC for Company / RCS
Affidavit of promoters that they have not availed CGC from any other institution for sanctioned Credit Facility.
Field inspection report of Bank Official as on recent date.
